--- title: "Analyzing The WAR Statistic for Pitchers" author: "Jonna Waage" date: "2023-06-28" --- ## What does the WAR statistic mean and what can be inferred from higher scores? Wins above replacement (WAR) is a statistic used to show how many wins a player is worth instead of their hypothetical replacement. This compares the player to a replacement level player at the same position, such as a free agent or a minor league player. The algorithm to calculate WAR is different for position players and pitchers. According to the [MLB glossary](https://www.mlb.com/glossary/advanced-stats/wins-above-replacement), the formula for WAR for pitchers is, "Different WAR computations use either RA9 or FIP. Those numbers are adjusted for league and ballpark. Then, using league averages, it is determined how many wins a pitcher was worth based on those numbers and his innings pitched total." RA9 is runs allowed per 9 innings pitched and "FIP is similar to ERA, but it focuses solely on the events a pitcher has the most control over -- strikeouts, unintentional walks, hit-by-pitches and home runs. It entirely removes results on balls hit into the field of play," also from the [MLB glossary.](https://www.mlb.com/glossary/advanced-stats/wins-above-replacement) To combat the possible difference of values from the different ways of calculating WAR for pitchers, all statistics will be taken from the same source.
Looking at pitchers that recorded at least 20 IP, data is from [here](https://www.fangraphs.com/leaders.aspx?pos=all&stats=pit&lg=all&qual=20&type=8&season=2022&month=0&season1=2022&ind=0&team=11&rost=0&age=0&filter=&players=0&startdate=2022-01-01&enddate=2022-12-31). ### Comparing WAR of pitchers and team win percentage in the 2022 season. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: The regression lines shows that there is a strong positive correlation between how many wins a team gets and how high their average WAR of their pitchers is. Houston was the 2022 World Series Winner and they had the biggest average war.
